intro: Viola portulacea, commonly known as the common pansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and vibrant, colorful flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers are usually blue, violet, or yellow, with a distinctive pattern of darker markings. Viola portulacea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to naturalize in gardens.
